items.title: Kevin Rudd to resign as Australian ambassador to the US a year early
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Mr Rudd will depart the role on March 31, a year before the posting was due to end, and says it was Mr Rudd's call.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week director resigns following author's removal
items.description: The director of Adelaide Writers' Week has resigned, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by a Palestinian-Australian author.

items.title: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone
items.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

items.title: As she hangs up her bat and gloves, Healy is set to conquer a new arena
items.description: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

items.title: How the Iranian regime uses the dead in its propaganda machine
items.description: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulate, the regime is accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.

items.title: Live: Harrowing return to Harcourt as Victorians tally bushfires damage
items.description: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares have been burnt. Follow live.

items.title: Three people rescued from central Queensland flood as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west
items.description: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut-off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

items.title: Donald Trump's attack on Federal Reserve is a 'spectacular unforced error'
items.description: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

items.title: Trump says countries doing business with Iran face 25 per cent tariff
items.description: US President Donald Trump takes to social media to announce tariffs, saying they would be "effective immediately".

items.title: Albanese calls national day of mourning for Bondi victims
items.description: There will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi terror attack this month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says.

items.title: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed
items.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: New passport changes create headache for Australian-British dual citizens
items.description: British-Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

items.title: 'Widespread alarm and turmoil': NSW boy facing jail over hoax calls to US
items.description: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

items.title: Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
items.description: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic.

items.title: Live: ASX rises after Wall Street rally despite Powell probe
items.description: Australian stocks start the day in positive fashion after investors on Wall Street mostly brush aside concerns about the US Justice Department's criminal investigation of Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. Follow live.

items.title: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid
items.description: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

items.title: Honey for vaginal health? How social ads target women
items.description: There's a large market online for products to put in or on our genital areas, blurring the lines between hygiene, cosmetics and medicine. This is how they hook consumers, and how you can check their claims.

items.title: 'How can I make my body look like that?': The pressures on elite female athletes
items.description: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

items.title: From 'baby hotels' to restaurant-quality food: Lessons from Japan's childcare system
items.description: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

items.title: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry
items.description: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

items.title: Situation in Iran 'under total control', claims government
items.description: Iran claims weeks of anti-government protests across the country have subsided, blaming the US and Israel for the violence.

items.title: Blame game begins over faulty Queensland rain gauges
items.description: Graziers say it was "back to the old days" as under-resourced rain gauges failed in north-west Queensland, with the widespread floods killing almost 50,000 cattle.

items.title: Not-so-young Endeavour readies to hand reins to successor
items.description: For 38 years, it has been "changing young Australian lives one voyage at a time" — but now it is time for the Young Endeavour to make way for its successor.

items.title: Greenland government rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'
items.description: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

items.title: CCTV released after second person charged over teen's fatal stabbing
items.description: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.
